card.shortDescription: A full-featured MERN platform for discovering, reviewing, and managing local food experiences with a role-based dashboard.

details.description: Local Food Lovers Network is a production-ready MERN stack application designed to connect food enthusiasts through reviews, ratings, and local food discovery. The platform includes authentication, role-based dashboards, protected routes, real-time analytics, and a scalable backend architecture. It emphasizes clean UI, real backend data, and professional dashboard workflows.

features.title: Advanced Search
features.description: Server-side MongoDB regex search for quickly finding food reviews.

features.title: Favorites System
features.description: Users can save favorite food reviews in a dedicated MongoDB collection.

features.title: Role-Based Access
features.description: Protected routes and dashboard access based on user and admin roles.

features.title: Real-Time Analytics
features.description: Dynamic charts and statistics powered by real backend data.

features.title: Responsive UI
features.description: Optimized for mobile, tablet, and desktop devices.

layout.description: Dedicated dashboard layout with a sticky top navbar, profile dropdown, and role-based sidebar navigation.

overview.dataTable: Dynamic data table populated from MongoDB showing recent reviews and user activity.

challenges: Designing a scalable role-based dashboard layout
Keeping dashboard analytics in sync with backend data
Maintaining UI consistency across public and private pages
solutions: Implemented JWT-based route protection and role guards
Built reusable dashboard components and sidebar logic
Used MongoDB aggregation pipelines for analytics
Standardized UI components for cards, charts, and tables

roadmap.title: Admin Moderation Tools
roadmap.description: Add approval and moderation workflows for reviews.

roadmap.title: Analytics Export
roadmap.description: Allow admins to export reports as CSV or PDF.

roadmap.title: Notifications System
roadmap.description: Notify users about review activity and admin actions.

card.shortDescription: A responsive React application for exploring hero apps, viewing ratings, installation details, and managing installed apps with a clean modern UI.

details.description: Hero Apps is a modern, responsive React-based web application developed for Hero IO Technologies Ltd. The platform allows users to explore hero applications, view ratings and installation details, and manage installed apps using local storage. The project emphasizes clean UI, smooth client-side navigation, loading animations, and an engaging user experience across all devices.

features.title: App Exploration
features.description: Browse a collection of hero applications with detailed information and ratings.

features.title: Ratings & Reviews
features.description: Visualize app reviews and ratings using responsive charts.

features.title: Install Management
features.description: Install apps and persist installation status using localStorage.

features.title: Toast Notifications
features.description: Instant feedback for user actions using toast and alert systems.

features.title: Fully Responsive UI
features.description: Optimized layout for mobile, tablet, and desktop devices.

layout.description: Simple app-focused layout with header navigation, dynamic pages, and smooth transitions between routes.

overview.dataTable: App list rendered from a local JSON object with dynamic filtering and search.

challenges: Managing installation state persistently using localStorage
Implementing smooth loading animations on navigation and search
Handling empty states and invalid routes gracefully
Maintaining responsive UI consistency across devices
solutions: Used localStorage to track installed apps and disable install buttons
Implemented route-based and search-based loading animations
Designed reusable components with conditional rendering
Leveraged Tailwind CSS for consistent responsive styling

roadmap.title: User Accounts
roadmap.description: Allow users to sign in and sync installed apps across devices.

roadmap.title: Advanced Filtering
roadmap.description: Add category and rating-based filters for apps.

roadmap.title: App Update Notifications
roadmap.description: Notify users when installed apps receive updates.

card.shortDescription: A cozy, winter-focused pet care platform that helps pet owners explore services, book care securely, and learn expert winter tips through a modern SPA.

details.description: Pet-X is a modern, winter-themed single-page application designed to help pet owners keep their furry companions warm, safe, and healthy during cold seasons. The platform offers curated winter pet care services, expert advice, secure booking via protected routes, and a smooth, responsive user experience enhanced with animations and toast notifications.

features.title: Winter Pet Services
features.description: Explore curated winter pet care services including grooming, clothing, and health support.

features.title: Protected Routes
features.description: Secure service details and booking pages accessible only after authentication.

features.title: Service Booking
features.description: Book pet care services with instant success notifications and form validation.

features.title: Winter Care Tips
features.description: Learn expert-recommended winter care tips to keep pets safe and healthy.

features.title: Smooth Animations
features.description: Enhanced user experience using Swiper, AOS, and Framer Motion animations.

layout.description: SPA layout with persistent navbar and footer, route-based content loading, and authentication-aware navigation.

overview.dataTable: Winter pet care services rendered dynamically from a JSON file.

features: View user name, email, and profile photo
Update profile name and image using Firebase updateProfile()

challenges: Implementing protected routes with redirect-after-login behavior
Managing Firebase authentication securely using environment variables
Ensuring reload-safe SPA deployment on Netlify
Handling profile updates and password reset flows smoothly
solutions: Used Firebase Authentication with private routes and auth context
Secured Firebase keys using environment variables
Configured Netlify redirects for SPA reload safety
Implemented toast notifications and form validation for UX feedback
